Title: the geology elevation

Scene: Outside Amy’s lab. Howard knocks on the door.
Bert: Thanks. I was as surprised as anybody. When they called and told me I won, I didn’t believe them. And then they said, no, you really won. And then I said, cool.
I’ve gotten pretty good at telling it. Well, see ya.
Thanks. I’ve been hearing that a lot. Ever since I won, people think I’m great.
You know, as a MacArthur Grant winner, I’m allowed to nominate someone for next year.
So I was thinking, you know, engineers don’t get a lot of respect. Is your friend Howard working on anything cool?
Wow, I won the MacArthur Grant, everyone’s jealous of me. Once I get Lasik, I’ll be out of things to wish for.
Well, you know, we’re both pretty smart. I bet if we put our heads together, we could come up with a solution.
Great. Now that we’re friends, want to see if we can get tickets to a taping of Ellen?
Sheldon, wait. You know, you’ve got a lot to be happy about. You’re at the top of your field, you have a great girlfriend.
It used to. But now that I’m rich and successful, I think I can do better.
Leonard: That is unbelievable. Good for Bert.
That’s Sheldon’s way of saying he’s proud of Bert, too.
How much money did he win?
Wow.
Right. Be polite.
Yeah, good for you.
I know, and it was the greatest sarcastic quip I’ve ever heard.
Ignore him, he’s just cranky because Bert from the geology lab won a big grant.
They say it could be a potential indicator of life on other planets.
It’s always fun watching him read someone else’s work.
What are you doing?
Hey, buddy, why don’t we go for a walk, so you can calm down.
Hey, I’m trying to help you.
You just wave your arms a little and they fly away, it’s not…
Really, why?
I couldn’t just take the compliment. I had to ask why. You know, I do understand what you’re feeling. My brother and sister’s accomplishments have always been held over my head.
I wet the bed until college, but I don’t think that’s a quality fix.
Do it. Visualize it as your anger and, and toss it out of your life.
Let it fly.
Then he got more angry and kicked the rock with his other foot.
Oh, I laughed so hard, I burst a blood vessel in my nose. It’s fine.
Although if you are gonna do it again, please let me know, so I can get it on video.
You’re up.
If it helps, I’m questioning your life choices, too.
Does it spin around and do tricks?
Then yeah.
Oh, how will we ever get used to the new you?
I think he might be learning on his own.
Excuse me, I have to go take some pictures.
It’s not hard. Just picture the Three Stooges, and then take away two stooges.
I’ve always been jealous of how much money Raj’s family has.
Yeah. I loved it. Love you, love the hair, would love to change the subject.
Oh, I don’t mind. If you pull a butterscotch out of your pocket, it would be like I’m walking with my grandma.
Well, change plaque to mixed-race couple and you are my grandma.
Hey, Sheldon, I’ve got someone here who might make you feel better.
Oh, it was a good one. He played poker with Sir Isaac, you don’t care.
Do not tell Wolowitz.

Ah.
And he doesn’t have to use it for research, he can do whatever he wants with it.
Here he comes.
Do you?
That’s amazing.
You busy? There’s somebody out here who wants to meet you.
Say hello to everybody’s little friend, remote control Stephen Hawking.
I found him in an old box.
I didn’t buy it. I made it.
What’s the big deal?
No, it’s not. Check it out, he says fun stuff.
His eyes also light up in the dark.
Okay, Raj, I’m gonna show you something. Now, one of us thinks it’s offensive, the other thinks it’s hilarious and a great idea. But, I’m not going to tell you who likes it.
You’re crazy. I’ve worked with Hawking. He’s got a great sense of humour, and I think he’d like it.
I have no problem calling him.
Fine, I will.
You laughed when that guy got hit in the nuts.
I’m conducting a quick survey. Do you think this respectful and loving tribute to a great man is in poor taste?
Do you think this is in poor taste?
Yeah
What do you think?
All right, we’re done. It’s offensive.
You’re in a good mood.
What is going on? Did you upgrade his software last night?
And I think you’re cute.
Raj: Couldn’t have happened to a nicer guy.
This is tough, but I’m going to say it’s the guy who shows me YouTube videos of people getting hit in the nuts.
I laughed because the guy was Leonard.
Well, I’m glad to see you moving forward.
Then the robot uprising has begun.
He doesn’t just look like C-3PO, now he walks like him.
It’s a human emotion, Sheldon. Everyone gets jealous. I’m jealous of Leonard and Penny and Howard and Bernadette for being in such happy relationships.
Thank you for saying that. Next to buying things, that is the best part about having money.
Sheldon: Everything is stupid and I want to go home.

Hey, it’s not even called the Genius Grant, it’s the MacArthur Fellowship. Just like it’s not Frankenstein, it’s Frankenstein’s Monster. Which brings us back to that hulking simpleton over there. And if anyone’s a genius, it’s me for the way I brought that full circle.
Oh, good, maybe he can build a nicer bridge to live under.
I know how to behave.
Someone call George R. R. Martin, this guy knows how to finish a story.
Some genius. I zinged him with sarcasm, he didn’t even notice.
Well, aren’t you a peach.
Who leaves their bike in the hallway? You know, if I knew how to ride one, I’d steal it.
Who listens to the radio any more?
You used to make those jokes about me. Now everything is Bert, Bert, Bert.
You want me to read a geology paper?
Yeh, why? Eh, why? Oh, that’s why.
I hope you’re happy making me read this. Bert’s work is remarkable, and I’m more upset than ever. This is worse than when I had to admit that Cedric the Entertainer’s actually entertaining.
Yeah, well I am angry. And you telling me not to be angry makes me angry. And do you know how hearing myself say the word angry over and over makes me feel?
That’s a good idea. I guess everyone’s having them now.
Fine. You can walk ahead of me and scare off the pigeons.
I admire you, Leonard.
You’re happy with who you are. You don’t get jealous of other people. Instead of being weighed down by ambition, you just float along like a dead body in a river.
How did you deal with it?
I can’t believe I was surpassed by a geologist. I mean, rocks. He studies rocks. If rock is so great, how come paper beats it? Leonard, I’m having a primal urge to throw this rock.
Perhaps I will. This rock encapsulates all my negative emotions. I will cast you far away. Feel free to take out a pigeon while you’re at it.
Ow, ow, ow, ow, ow, ow, ow, ow…
I tried to let go of anger and threw a rock into my foot.
Yeah, but you’ve got all those things, and no one’s lining up to be you.
Uh, do you really think calling me names is helpful?
Maybe you’re right.
Thank you, Penny. You know, I just need to keep reminding myself that Bert’s success is not my failure.
And that men of his large stature are more susceptible to a wide array of life-threatening diseases.
Top of the afternoon, gentlemen.
Well, it’s a new day. I have a new outlook. You know, I realized I don’t need to worry about other people. I just need to think more about myself.
Bert did quality research, and he deserves whatever accolades he receives.
Excuse me, I need to pay Bert a proper congratulations.
Bert? I wanted to let you know that I read your research, and your award is well-deserved.
Well, just this once, you can count me as people, too.
Really? I didn’t know that.
You know, I’m not sure. You know, you’d have to ask him. Excuse me. (Off) Aah. Leonard, I hurt myself again.

I’m so disappointed in myself. Jealousy is completely illogical.
Sorry I’m moving slowly.
Oh, no. A plaque? Nobody wants to see this.

All right, let’s do this, Bert? We need to talk.
Rock, rock, water fountain. I am not proud of this, but I have been envious of your recent success.

No. Now that you know my weakness, I hate you more than ever.
We, hang on, you’re my enemy. Now, the enemy of the enemy is my friend. And right now, I’m my own worst enemy. That makes you my friend. Okay, I’m good to go.
You know what? This isn’t gonna work.
Yes, that’s right. I have Amy. In the past, you’ve professed feelings for her. Does it eat you up inside that I have her and you don’t?
I didn’t punch him. He turned around, and I gave him a Captain Kirk karate chop. I’m not even sure he knows I did it.
Professor Hawking.
Thanks, Leonard, now he’s not gonna think I’m cool.
How do you deal with the success of your colleagues?

What a wonderful idea, how does this man not have a Nobel?

I do, your life is fine you big baby.

Oh, wow, that doesn’t seem fair.
